| Region | Suitable crops | Suitable livestock | Topography / land type | Climate / rainfall |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Branco River | Rice, beans, cassava | Cattle | Flat, fertile soil | Tropical, rainy season from January to May |
| Pacaraima Mountains | - | Goats, sheep, dairy cattle | Hilly, cooler climate | Tropical, rainy season from January to May |
| Serra do Tepequém | Rice, beans, cassava | Cattle | Flat, fertile soil | Tropical, rainy season from January to May |

Overall, the Branco River region is suitable for a wide range of crops and cattle farming due to its flat, fertile soil and tropical climate with a rainy season from January to May. The Pacaraima Mountains region is particularly suitable for livestock farming, particularly goats, sheep, and dairy cattle, due to its hilly terrain and cooler climate. The Serra do Tepequém region is suitable for cattle farming and growing crops such as rice, beans, and cassava due to its flat, fertile soil and tropical climate with a rainy season from January to May.
